definition: whole body/from head to toe/single person/a suit of clothes
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to be all alone in the world
one person taking on two tasks simultaneously
one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb)/to a fearless person, no fence is high enough
pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
containing_words.word: 捨得一身剮，敢把皇帝拉下馬

sentences.english: Why are you wearing a different unifomp3?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼穿了一身不同的制服呢？

sentences.english: AlthoughI walked slowly, I got hot and sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我走得慢，但是我還是熱出了一身汗。

sentences.english: Laser battle is fashionably military sport integrated with entertainment and training.
sentences.chinese: 雷戰是一種集娛樂和培訓於一身的時尚軍事體育運動。

sentences.english: Cutting edge rolling pin rolls, cuts, and stores all in one.
sentences.chinese: 擀麪杖捲刃，割傷，並存儲於一身。

sentences.english: Sheep are known for their thick coat of fleece.
sentences.chinese: 綿羊以一身厚密的羊毛著稱。

sentences.english: It combines many functions in one. It is a high grade product.
sentences.chinese: 它集多種功能於一身，是高檔商品。

sentences.english: Of course, I am still an adept compared to other strong English learners.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我仍然比其他較強的英語學習者練就了一身好。

sentences.english: Helen was in a cold sweat from fear when she sighted the corpse.
sentences.chinese: 海倫看到屍體，嚇出了一身冷汗。

sentences.english: I did a double-take when I saw her dressed in biker 's gear.
sentences.chinese: 看見她一身賽車手打扮，我一時沒反應過來。

sentences.english: After a long walk, he wore a black sweat.
sentences.chinese: 長途跋涉後，他出了一身臭汗。

sentences.english: He has a white beard and wears a red suit.
sentences.chinese: 他留着白鬍子，穿一身紅衣服。

sentences.english: Would you be shocked if I changed into something more comfortable?
sentences.chinese: 假如我換一身更舒服的衣服你會覺得震驚嗎？

sentences.english: After his wife's death,he was alone in the world.
sentences.chinese: 妻子去世後，他在這世上就孑然一身。

sentences.english: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
sentences.chinese: 又保全他一身的骨頭，連一根也不折斷。

sentences.english: He smelled of horses and dogs and blood and leather.
sentences.chinese: 他一身馬和狗的味道，還有血和皮革味。

sentences.english: I thought I'd stay single and always be free. But that was before I met you.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲孑然一身便無憂無擾，直到我遇見了你。

definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
